DOC.brief_summary: The objective of the study is to compare electrocardiograms using ambulatory holter monitor with dry electrodes in a harness versus using an ambulatory holter with standard sticky electrodes (Red Dot) on monitored patients within the hospital. Patients will be simultaneously be hooked up to two ambulatory Holter monitors for the period of time to be not less than one hour. One holter will use standard electrodes in a standard electrode distribution. The second holter will use dry electrodes in a derived.
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Comparison of Electrocardiograms Collected Using an Ambulatory Holter
DOC.criteria: Any patient within the hospital either for procedure or for admission Patients who cannot wear a Holter monitor Patients undergoing an MRI or have other contraindications for wearing an ambulatory Holter monitor.
